item.title: 坎耶-维斯特在超级碗广告之后在 Shopify 上出售纳粹标志衬衫
item.description: 说唱歌手坎耶-韦斯特（Kanye West，人称 "Ye"）在 "超级碗 "期间打出广告，在 Shopify 公司托管的网站上销售纳粹标志衬衫。【原文：A site advertised during the Super Bowl by the rapper Kanye West, known as Ye, is selling swastika shirts on a site hosted by Shopify Inc.】

item.title: 马里开始征收手机使用税以资助反恐斗争
item.description: 马里对手机语音通话和手机取款征税，以支持其打击伊斯兰叛乱的斗争。【原文：Mali has introduced taxes on mobile voice calls and mobile-money withdrawals to support its fight against an Islamic insurgency that’s threatening to take over part of the country.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，马斯克领导的集团出价 974 亿美元收购 OpenAI 控制权
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的一个投资者集团正在出价 974 亿美元收购控制 ChatGPT 创造者 OpenAI 的非营利组织。【原文：A group of investors led by Elon Musk is offering $97.4 billion to buy the nonprofit that controls ChatGPT creator OpenAI, the Wall Street Journal reported Monday.】

item.title: 泰珀放弃中国赌注，不惧刺激政策推动的涨势消退
item.description: 亿万富翁投资者大卫-泰珀（David Tepper）上个季度增持了与中国有关的股票和交易所交易基金，显示出他对中国这个世界第二大经济体的信心，即使刺激经济的反弹势头已经减弱。【原文：Billionaire investor David Tepper ramped up his stake in China-related stocks and exchange-traded funds last quarter, showing confidence in the world’s second-largest economy even as a stimulus-fueled rally lost momentum.】

item.title: 华尔街银行谋划加密货币未来，押注 IPO 热潮
item.description: 在保持观望之后，华尔街一些最大的银行正在谋划如何赢得更多的加密货币业务，赌唐纳德-特朗普总统对该行业的支持会掀起一股首次公开募股、股票销售和可转换债券的浪潮。【原文：After staying on the sidelines, some of Wall Street’s biggest banks are plotting how to win more crypto business, betting President Donald Trump’s embrace of the industry unleashes a wave of IPOs, share sales and convertible bonds.】

item.title: 凯雷秘密申请化工公司 Nouryon 在美国上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. has filed confidentially for an initial public offering of specialty chemicals producer Nouryon in the US, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 西联汇款以新制裁为由停止向古巴汇款
item.description: 西联公司无限期暂停了向古巴的汇款业务，理由是美国的新制裁可能会进一步破坏这个挣扎中的加勒比国家的经济。【原文：Western Union has indefinitely suspended money transfers to Cuba citing new US sanctions that are likely to further undermine the struggling Caribbean nation’s economy.】

item.title: DeepSeek 创始人身价是 10 亿美元还是 1500 亿美元，取决于你问谁
item.description: DeepSeek 创始人梁文峰不到两年前开始的副业可能会让他跻身全球最富有的人之列，或者仅仅成为一名亿万富翁。【原文：What began as a side hustle less than two years ago could turn DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng into one of the world’s richest people — or a mere billionaire.】

item.title: Meta 开始裁员，转向寻找人工智能人才
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周一开始通知员工裁员，启动了一个将解雇数千人的过程，因为该公司正在打击 "低绩效者"，并寻找新的人才来主导人工智能竞赛。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. began notifying staff of job cuts on Monday, kick-starting a process that will terminate thousands of people as the company cracks down on “low-performers” and scours for new talent to dominate the AI race.】

item.title: 金融科技初创公司 Plaid 据称将与高盛合作出售股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，以促进初创企业与传统银行之间的沟通而闻名的金融科技公司 Plaid Inc.【原文：Plaid Inc., a financial technology firm best known for facilitating communication between startups and traditional banks, is working with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. on a sale of existing shares, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利启动价值 29.7 亿美元的 X 贷款出售项目
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在出售了 X 公司 55 亿美元的债务后不到一周，又开始寻求出售 X 公司的另一大部分债务，这些债务已在该公司的账簿上滞留多年。【原文：Morgan Stanley is looking to offload another large portion of X Corp.’s debt, less than week after it sold $5.5 billion of the social-media platform’s loans that had been stuck on its books for years.】

item.title: 埃利奥特激进主义的成功为英国石油公司低迷的股价带来希望
item.description: 在过去几年里，英国石油公司（BP Plc）的股东们眼睁睁地看着自己的投资被拖累，他们正寄希望于激进分子埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management LP）的业绩记录来帮助他们从自己的头寸中获取一些价值。【原文：Beleaguered shareholders of BP Plc who’ve watched their investment lag over the past few years are banking on activist Elliott Investment Management LP’s track record to help them extract some value from their positions.】

item.title: 米莱在卡瓦略的外交官女儿批评比索后解雇了他
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）在一位著名经济学家的女儿发表了一篇批评这位自由主义者货币政策的博文后没几天就将其解雇了。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei fired the daughter of a famous economist just days after he published a critical blog post about the libertarian’s currency policy.】

item.title: 特朗普违抗最后命令，被指示释放所有资金
item.description: 一名法官周一裁定，特朗普政府必须立即解冻所有 3 万亿美元的联邦资金，因为他发现，特朗普政府暂停冻结部分资金违反了临时限制令。【原文：The Trump administration must immediately unfreeze all $3 trillion in federal funds, a judge ruled Monday, finding it violated his temporary restraining order by keeping some of the dollars paused.】

item.title: 津巴布韦金币以创纪录的 3,000 美元售出，金银价格飙升
item.description: 随着金块价格的飙升，津巴布韦金币的销售额自近三年前推出以来首次突破 3000 美元。【原文：Zimbabwe’s gold coins sold above $3,000 for the first time since they were introduced almost three years ago as the price of bullion surged.】

item.title: 法国称将保留数字税，尽管面临报复风险
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴（Eric Lombard）表示，在贸易紧张局势加剧之际，法国不会为了安抚唐纳德-特朗普而放弃对美国大型科技跨国公司征收数字税。【原文：France will not give up on its digital tax that hits major US tech multinationals to appease Donald Trump amid heightened trade tensions, Finance Minister Eric Lombard said.】

item.title: 哈塞特称，特朗普的国债言论针对的是支付而非债务
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的最高经济顾问周一表示，特朗普总统周末就财政部付款违规行为发表的评论是指亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）声称政府向承包商和赠款接受者不当转账—；而不是表达对债券持有人付款的担忧。【原文：President Donald Trump’s weekend comments regarding irregularities in Treasury payments were a reference to billionaire Elon Musk’s claims that the government had made improper transfers to contractors and grant recipients — not an expression of concern about payments to bondholders, the president’s top economic adviser said Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普关税动荡令债券市场通胀指标承压
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统计划对贸易伙伴和一些工业部门征收关税之后，债券投资者押注美联储将不得不再次应对物价上涨，而且是很快。【原文：Bond investors are betting that the Federal Reserve will have to contend with rising prices once again, and soon, in the wake of President Donald Trump’s plan to slap tariffs on trading partners and some industrial sectors.】

item.title: 收益持平，大科技公司对市场的掌控出现裂痕
item.description: 基于利润增长有望重新加速的假设而买入高价大科技股的理由开始变得站不住脚。【原文：The case for buying pricey Big Tech stocks on the assumption that profit growth is poised to re-accelerate is starting to look shaky.】

item.title: 法国电力公司将为法国数据中心建设招标六个地点
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）计划为新数据中心的六个选址进行招标，预计人工智能的蓬勃发展将需要大量新的基础设施。【原文：Electricite de France SA plans to tender six sites for new data centers on the expectation that burgeoning use of artificial intelligence will require a host of new infrastructure.】

item.title: 马克龙宣布投资 1090 亿欧元力争成为人工智能中心
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）表示，外国公司和国内公司将在法国的人工智能项目上投资总计1090亿欧元（约合1130亿美元），这标志着法国将成为人工智能发展的竞争中心。【原文：President Emmanuel Macron said foreign and domestic companies will invest a total of €109 billion ($113 billion) in artificial intelligence projects in France, marking a push to position the country as a competitive hub for AI development.】

item.title: 鲍威尔将出席因特朗普而受到 "过度关注 "的听证会
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔本周在国会山将面临一系列艰难的听证会，民主党和共和党都可能就唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策对他进行质询，这些政策包括银行业法规，以及已经席卷央行的多元化、公平和包容性工作的倒退。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell faces a tough set of hearings this week on Capitol Hill with both Democrats and Republicans likely to prod him on President Donald Trump’s policies ranging from banking regulations to a rollback of diversity, equity and inclusion efforts that has already engulfed the central bank.】

item.title: Snap 计划发行 7 亿美元垃圾股回购可转换债券
item.description: 社交媒体公司 Snap Inc. 周一在一份声明中表示，该公司计划发行 7 亿美元的垃圾债券，用于回购可转换债务。【原文：Snap Inc. plans to offer $700 million of junk bonds to repurchase convertible debt, the social-media company said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 西班牙因德意志银行出售衍生品罚款 1000 万欧元
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）被西班牙证券监管机构 CNMV 罚款 1000 万欧元（1030 万美元），原因是德意志银行向客户销售衍生产品，而这些客户后来表示他们并不了解这些产品，并因此蒙受了巨大损失。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG was fined €10 million ($10.3 million) by Spain’s securities regulator CNMV for selling derivatives to clients who later said they didn’t understand the products and suffered steep losses as a result.】

item.title: 希思罗机场将宣布加快扩建，并承诺优先发展英国钢铁业
item.description: 伦敦希思罗机场将公布一项短期扩建计划，其中包括及时承诺优先使用受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税威胁的英国钢铁，在第三条跑道建成之前为该枢纽提供潜在的推动力。【原文：London’s Heathrow airport will unveil a short-term expansion plan including a timely commitment to prioritize British steel under threat from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs, offering the hub a potential boost before a third runway is built.】

item.title: BC Partners 据称将为新旗舰基金募集高达 60 亿欧元的资金
item.description: 私募股权公司 BC Partners 计划为其最新旗舰基金募集 50 亿欧元（52 亿美元）至 60 亿欧元的资金，知情人士透露，该公司希望借助最近在资产剥离方面取得的成功来应对依然困难的筹资环境。【原文：Private equity firm BC Partners is planning to seek €5 billion ($5.2 billion) to €6 billion for its latest flagship fund, people with knowledge of the matter said, counting on its recent success in divesting assets to navigate a still-difficult fundraising environment.】

item.title: 机构称监管负担拖累加拿大经济增长
item.description: 加拿大中央统计局称，在 15 年的时间里，不断增加的规章制度使加拿大商业部门的产出增长减少了近 2 个百分点。【原文：The rising number of rules and regulations shaved almost 2 percentage points off the growth in output from Canada’s business sector over a 15-year period, the country’s central statistics agency said.】

item.title: 敢于冒险的杠杆交易者扩大了 950 亿美元的 ETF 多头赌注
item.description: 散户敢死队— 没有被华尔街最近对人工智能和加密货币的担忧所吓倒— 正在做多，将杠杆基金的规模提高到近1000亿美元，而悲观的市场赌注却萎靡不振。【原文：Retail daredevils — undeterred by recent Wall Street jitters over AI and crypto — are going long, pumping up leveraged funds to nearly $100 billion, while pessimistic market wagers languish.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称通货紧缩已步入正轨，但贸易带来风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，尽管全球贸易摩擦继续构成风险，但通胀回落正在取得进展。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the retreat in inflation is progressing, though global trade friction continues to posing risks.】

item.title: 安大略省表示将禁止中国参与矿产和能源交易
item.description: 加拿大最大省份的领导人表示，如果他所在的政党在本月晚些时候获得连任，政府将禁止中国组件参与能源项目。【原文：The leader of Canada’s largest province said the government will ban Chinese components from energy projects if his party is reelected later this month.】
